results.title: Best Movies of 2020
results.byline: By Manohla Dargis and A.O. Scott
results.abstract: The screening rooms were closed. The festivals were virtual. The blockbusters were in storage. Even so, our critics found abundant and inspiring signs of cinematic life in the pandemic.

results.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling
results.title: Trading Box Office for Streaming, but Stars Still Want Their Money
results.abstract: If studios are no longer trying to maximize ticket sales, what will that mean for often lucrative pay packages tied to a film’s performance in theaters?

results.title: ‘Mank’ and Politics: What Really Happened in 1934 California
results.abstract: In the Netflix drama, Hollywood gets involved in the race for governor. But while that’s based in fact, history didn’t exactly go down that way.

multimedia.caption: Bill Nye as Upton Sinclair, the author-turned-political candidate in “Mank.”

results.title: A Costly Quip Angers Chinese Moviegoers, and a Film Is Yanked
results.abstract: “Monster Hunter” disappeared from theaters in China after online critics labeled a snippet of dialogue — a pun about knees — racist and called for a boycott.

multimedia.caption: Milla Jovovich and Tony Jaa in the movie “Monster Hunter.”

results.title: Who Wrote ‘Citizen Kane’? It’s No Mystery
results.abstract: The Netflix drama “Mank” suggests that Herman J. Mankiewicz, credited along with Orson Welles, primarily wrote the script. But that has long been debunked by scholars.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “Mank.” The film details the writer’s acquaintance with William Randolph Hearst, the inspiration for Charles Foster Kane.

results.title: What Hearing Loss Feels Like in ‘Sound of Metal’
results.abstract: The director Darius Marder and the sound designer Nicolas Becker went to great lengths to put viewers inside the head of a musician going deaf.

results.title: ‘Mank’ Review: A Rosebud by Any Other Name
results.abstract: Gary Oldman plays a Hollywood hack with an ax to grind in David Fincher’s reinterpretation of the legend of “Citizen Kane.”

results.title: 2 Major Movies and a Life Shadowed by Pain and Perfectionism
results.abstract: Kemp Powers is the co-director of “Soul” and screenwriter of “One Night in Miami,” but his collaborators may not know just how much of himself is in those films.

multimedia.caption: “I’ve had a year that writers, creatives in Hollywood don’t get to have, ever,” Kemp Powers said.

results.title: Pamela Tiffin, Movie Star Who Shone Brightly but Briefly, Dies at 78
results.abstract: Billy Wilder called her “the greatest film discovery since Audrey Hepburn,” and she made an immediate splash in two 1961 movies, when she was only 19.

multimedia.caption: Pamela Tiffin in 1965 in Madrid. A former model, she said she preferred acting. “A model sells herself,” she said, “but an actress sells the characters she plays.”

results.abstract: The author, who died in 1990, made several disparaging comments about Jews during his lifetime. “Those prejudiced remarks are incomprehensible to us,” the family said in a statement online.
results.title: Roald Dahl’s Family Apologizes for His Anti-Semitism
Warren Berlinger, Film and Television Character Actor, Dies at 83
results.abstract: Mr. Berlinger, who had dozens of roles in a career that spanned more than six decades, appeared in “Happy Days” and “The Cannonball Run.”

results.title: What to Watch: Modern Takes on Noir
results.abstract: A troubled private eye. A dangerous woman. A twisty plot with a conspiracy that goes all the way to the top. Check out five modern takes on film noir.

results.title: Fernando Solanas, Argentine Filmmaker and Politician, Dies at 84
results.abstract: He helped propel a new wave of politically charged moviemaking and served as a lawmaker. He died of complications of the coronavirus.

results.title: A Cinematic Love Letter to Denmark’s Drinking Culture
results.abstract: Thomas Vinterberg’s “Another Round” explores the highs and lows of the Danes’ love of alcohol, at a time when their hard-drinking habits are under new scrutiny.

results.abstract: The Netflix drama about the making of “Citizen Kane” features characters based on Hollywood writers, studio executives and others. Here’s what they were really like.
results.title: Who’s Who in ‘Mank’: A Guide to the Real-Life Players

results.abstract: An inexperienced fairy godmother tries to make over a Bostonian single mom in this modernized fairy tale.

results.title: Best Performances of 2020
results.abstract: One day, we’ll look back on this year and bawl. But we should also remember that there were professionals out there who dared to bring joy to our screens.
The Times’s co-chief film critics explain their rationale for some surprising inclusions, and exclusions, on their list of the greatest actors of the 21st century (so far).
results.title: Meryl Streep Isn’t on Our List of Greatest Actors. Here’s Why.

results.abstract: Perhaps no playwright has asserted the richness and complexity of everyday Black lives and language so deeply. Now, two screen projects affirm his legacy for new audiences.
results.title: August Wilson, American Bard

results.title: ‘Billie’ Review: A Legend, in a Different Light
results.abstract: The journalist Linda Lipnack Kuehl worked for years on a Billie Holiday biography before Kuehl’s sudden death in 1978. The director of this documentary bought her research, and uses it well.

results.abstract: An uptight Mexican aviation executive and an American doofus learn they’re related in this mawkish comedy.
